briefdescription.para: The current scale of the map is used for each feature of the atlas.
A scale is chosen from the predefined scales.

detaileddescription.para:
The smallest scale from the list of scales where the atlas feature is fully visible is chosen.
QgsAtlasComposition::setPredefinedScales.
This mode is only valid for polygon or line atlas coverage layers

briefdescription.para: The extent is adjusted so that each feature is fully visible.

detaileddescription.para:
A margin is applied around the center
setAtlasMargin
This mode is only valid for polygon or line atlas coverage layers

briefdescription.para: Scaling modes used for the serial rendering (atlas)
Whether to draw labels which are partially outside of the map view.
Various flags that affect drawing of map items.
True if map is being controlled by an atlas.
Margin size for atlas driven extents (percentage of feature size) - when in auto scaling mode.
Current atlas scaling mode.
Empty if no cached style overrides stored.
Cached style overrides, used to avoid frequent expensive lookups of the preset style override.
True if cached map image must be recreated.
Map CRS.
Current bounding rectangle. This is used to check if notification to the graphics scene is necessary.
True if annotation items, rubber band, etc. from the main canvas should be displayed.
Temporary evaluated map rotation.

detaileddescription.para: Data defined rotation may mean this value differs from mMapRotation

briefdescription.para: Whether layers and styles should be used from a preset (preset name is stored in mVisibilityPresetName and may be overridden by data-defined expression).

detaileddescription.para: This flag has higher priority than mKeepLayerSet.

briefdescription.para: Map theme name to be used for map's layers and styles in case mFollowVisibilityPreset is true.

detaileddescription.para: May be overridden by data-defined expression.

briefdescription.para: Flag if layers to be displayed should be read from qgis canvas (true) or from stored list in mLayerSet (false)
Stored layer list (used if layer live-link mKeepLayerSet is disabled)
Stored style names (value) to be used with particular layer IDs (key) instead of default style.
Unique identifier.
Map rotation.
Number of layers when cache was created.
Offset in x direction for showing map cache image.
Offset in y direction for showing map cache image.
Constructor for QgsLayoutItemMap, with the specified parent layout.
Sets the specified layout item as a "label blocking item" for this map.

detaileddescription.para: Items which are marked as label blocking items prevent any map labels from being placed in the area of the map item covered by the item.

briefdescription.para: Sets the map id() to a number not yet used in the layout.

detaileddescription.para: The existing id() is kept if it is not in use.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the map extent is set to follow the current atlas feature.

simplesect.para: true if map will follow the current atlas feature.

briefdescription.para: Returns the margin size (percentage) used when the map is in atlas mode.

parameterdescription.para: controls whether the returned value is the user specified atlas margin, or the current evaluated atlas margin (which may be affected by data driven atlas margin settings).

simplesect.para: margin size in percentage to leave around the atlas feature's extent
this is only used if atlasScalingMode() is Auto.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current atlas scaling mode.

detaileddescription.para:
This controls how the map's extents are calculated for the current atlas feature when an atlas composition is enabled.
the current scaling mode
this parameter is only used if atlasDriven() is true
setAtlasScalingMode
atlasDriven

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the item contains contents with blend modes or transparency effects which can only be reproduced by rastering the item.

detaileddescription.para: Subclasses should ensure that implemented overrides of this method also check the base class result.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the map contains a WMS layer.
This method needs to be reimplemented in all classes which implement this interface and return an expression context.
Returns coordinate reference system used for rendering the map.

detaileddescription.para:
This will match the presetCrs() if that is set, or if a preset CRS is not set then the map's CRS will follow the composition's project's CRS.
presetCrs()
setCrs()

briefdescription.para: Gets item display name.

detaileddescription.para:
This is the item's id if set, and if not, a user-friendly string identifying item type.
id()
setId()

briefdescription.para: Returns whether annotations are drawn within the map.
Returns the current map extent.
Called after all pending items have been restored from XML.

detaileddescription.para:
Items can use this method to run steps which must take place after all items have been restored to the layout, such as connecting to signals emitted by other items, which may not have existed in the layout at the time readXml() was called. E.g. a scalebar can use this to connect to its linked map item after restoration from XML.
readXml()

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the map should follow a map theme.

detaileddescription.para: If true, the layers and layer styles will be used from given preset name (configured with setFollowVisibilityPresetName() method). This means when preset's settings are changed, the new settings are automatically picked up next time when rendering, without having to explicitly update them. At most one of the flags keepLayerSet() and followVisibilityPreset() should be enabled at any time since they are alternative approaches - if both are enabled, following map theme has higher priority. If neither is enabled (or if preset name is not set), map will use the same configuration as the map canvas uses.

briefdescription.para: Preset name that decides which layers and layer styles are used for map rendering.

detaileddescription.para:
It is only used when followVisibilityPreset() returns true.
setFollowVisibilityPresetName()

briefdescription.para: Returns the map item's first grid.

detaileddescription.para:
This is a convenience function.
grids()

briefdescription.para: Returns the map item's grid stack, which is used to control how grids are drawn over the map's contents.
Returns the item's icon.
Returns true if the specified item is a "label blocking item".

detaileddescription.para: Items which are marked as label blocking items prevent any map labels from being placed in the area of the map item covered by the item.

briefdescription.para: Returns the item's flags, which indicate how the item behaves.
Returns whether a stored layer set should be used or the current layer set from the project associated with the layout.

detaileddescription.para:
This is just a GUI flag, and itself does not change which layers are rendered in the map. Instead, use setLayers() to control which layers are rendered.
setKeepLayerSet()
layers()

briefdescription.para: Returns whether current styles of layers should be overridden by previously stored styles.
Returns the margin from the map edges in which no labels may be placed.

detaileddescription.para: If the margin is 0 then labels can be placed right up to the edge (and possibly overlapping the edge) of the map.

briefdescription.para: Returns the stored layer set.

detaileddescription.para:
If empty, the current project layers will be used instead.
setLayers()
keepLayerSet()

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of the layers which will be rendered within this map item, considering any locked layers, linked map theme, and data defined settings.
Returns stored overrides of styles for layers.
Returns the map item's flags, which control how the map content is drawn.
Returns the rotation used for drawing the map within the layout item, in degrees clockwise.

parameterdescription.para: controls whether the returned value is the user specified rotation, or the current evaluated rotation (which may be affected by data driven rotation settings).

memberdef.argsstring: (const QgsRectangle &extent, QSizeF size, double dpi, bool includeLayerSettings) const
memberdef.name: mapSettings

briefdescription.para: Returns map settings that will be used for drawing of the map.

detaileddescription.para: If includeLayerSettings is true, than settings specifically relating to map layers and map layer styles will be calculated. This can be expensive to calculate, so if they are not required in the map settings (e.g. for map settings which are used for scale related calculations only) then includeLayerSettings should be false.

briefdescription.para: Returns the conversion factor from map units to layout units.

detaileddescription.para: This is calculated using the width of the map item and the width of the current visible map extent.

briefdescription.para: Moves the content of the item, by a specified dx and dy in layout units.

detaileddescription.para:
The default implementation has no effect.
setMoveContentPreviewOffset()
zoomContent()

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of layers that this item requires for exporting during layered exports (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: SVG). Returns 0 if this item is to be placed on the same layer as the previous item, 1 if it should be placed on its own layer, and >1 if it requires multiple export layers.
Items which require multiply layers should check QgsLayoutContext::currentExportLayer() during their rendering to determine which layer should be drawn.

briefdescription.para: Returns the map item's first overview.

detaileddescription.para:
This is a convenience function.
pointer to first overview for map item
overviews()

briefdescription.para: Returns the map item's overview stack, which is used to control how overviews are drawn over the map's contents.
Returns the map's preset coordinate reference system.

detaileddescription.para:
If set, this CRS will be used to render the map regardless of any project CRS setting. If the returned CRS is not valid then the project CRS will be used to render the map.
crs()
setCrs()

briefdescription.para: Removes the specified layout item from the map's "label blocking items".

detaileddescription.para: Items which are marked as label blocking items prevent any map labels from being placed in the area of the map item covered by the item.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the item is drawn in such a way that forces the whole layout to be rasterized when exporting to vector formats.
Returns the map scale.

detaileddescription.para:
The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map.
setScale()

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the map extent will follow the current atlas feature.

parameterdescription.para: set to true if the map extents should be set by the current atlas feature.

briefdescription.para: Sets the margin size (percentage) used when the map is in atlas mode.

parameterdescription.para: size in percentage to leave around the atlas feature's extent

simplesect.para: this is only used if atlasScalingMode() is Auto.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current atlas scaling mode.

detaileddescription.para:
This controls how the map's extents are calculated for the current atlas feature when an atlas composition is enabled.
mode
atlas scaling mode to set
this parameter is only used if atlasDriven() is true
atlasScalingMode
atlasDriven

briefdescription.para: Sets the map's preset crs (coordinate reference system).

detaileddescription.para:
If a valid CRS is set, this CRS will be used to render the map regardless of any project CRS setting. If the CRS is not valid then the project CRS will be used to render the map.
crs()
presetCrs()

briefdescription.para: Sets whether annotations are drawn within the map.
Sets a new extent for the map.

detaileddescription.para:
This method may change the width or height of the map item to ensure that the extent exactly matches the specified extent, with no overlap or margin. This method implicitly alters the map scale.
zoomToExtent()
extentChanged()

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the map should follow a map theme.

detaileddescription.para: See followVisibilityPreset() for more details.

briefdescription.para: Sets preset name for map rendering.

detaileddescription.para:
See followVisibilityPresetName() for more details.
followVisibilityPresetName()

briefdescription.para: Sets the frame stroke width.
Sets whether the stored layer set should be used or the current layer set of the associated project.

detaileddescription.para:
This is just a GUI flag, and itself does not change which layers are rendered in the map. Instead, use setLayers() to control which layers are rendered.
keepLayerSet()
layers()

briefdescription.para: Sets whether current styles of layers should be overridden by previously stored styles.
Sets the margin from the map edges in which no labels may be placed.

detaileddescription.para: If the margin is 0 then labels can be placed right up to the edge (and possibly overlapping the edge) of the map.

briefdescription.para: Sets the stored layers set.

detaileddescription.para:
If empty, the current project layers will be used instead.
layers()
keepLayerSet()

briefdescription.para: Sets the stored overrides of styles for layers.
Sets the map item's flags, which control how the map content is drawn.
Sets the rotation for the map - this does not affect the layout item shape, only the way the map is drawn within the item.

detaileddescription.para:
Rotation is in degrees, clockwise.
mapRotation()
mapRotationChanged()

briefdescription.para: Sets temporary offset for the item, by a specified dx and dy in layout units.

detaileddescription.para:
This is useful for live updates when moving item content in a QgsLayoutView. The default implementation has no effect.
moveContent()

briefdescription.para: Sets new map scale and changes only the map extent.

detaileddescription.para: The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map.

briefdescription.para: Stores the current project layer styles into style overrides.
Returns a polygon representing the current visible map extent, considering map extents and rotation.

detaileddescription.para:
If the map rotation is 0, the result is the same as currentMapExtent
polygon with the four corner points representing the visible map extent. The points are clockwise, starting at the top-left point
extent()

briefdescription.para: Zooms content of item.

detaileddescription.para:
Does nothing by default.
factor
zoom factor, where > 1 results in a zoom in and < 1 results in a zoom out
point
item point for zoom center
moveContent()

briefdescription.para: Zooms the map so that the specified extent is fully visible within the map item.

detaileddescription.para:
This method will not change the width or height of the map, and may result in an overlap or margin from the specified extent. This method implicitly alters the map scale.
setExtent()

briefdescription.para: Returns a new map item for the specified layout.

detaileddescription.para: The caller takes responsibility for deleting the returned object.

briefdescription.para: Draws the item's contents using the specified item render context.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the context's painter has been scaled so that painter units are pixels. Use the QgsRenderContext methods to convert from millimeters or other units to the painter's units.

briefdescription.para: True if a draw is already in progress.
Transforms map coordinates to item coordinates (considering rotation and move offset)

memberdef.argsstring: (const QDomElement &element, const QDomDocument &document, const QgsReadWriteContext &context) override
memberdef.name: readPropertiesFromElement

briefdescription.para: Sets item state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
element
is the DOM element for the item
document
DOM document
context
read write context
Note that item subclasses should not rely on all other items being present in the layout at the time this method is called. Instead, any connections and links to other items must be made in the finalizeRestoreFromXml() method. E.g. when restoring a scalebar, the connection to the linked map's signals should be implemented in finalizeRestoreFromXml(), not readPropertiesFromElement().

briefdescription.para: Calculates the extent to request and the yShift of the top-left point in case of rotation.
Returns extent that considers rotation and shift with mOffsetX / mOffsetY.
Stores item state within an XML DOM element.

parameterdescription.para: is the DOM element to store the item's properties in

briefdescription.para: Is emitted when the map's extent changes.
Emitted when layer style overrides are changed...

detaileddescription.para: a means to let associated legend items know they should update

briefdescription.para: Is emitted when the map's rotation changes.
Is emitted when the map has been prepared for atlas rendering, just before actual rendering.
Updates the bounding rect of this item. Call this function before doing any changes related to annotation out of the map rectangle.
Create cache image.
Establishes signal/slot connection for update in case of layer change.
Returns first map grid or creates an empty one if none.
Returns first map overview or creates an empty one if none.
Creates a list of label blocking regions for the map, which correspond to the map areas covered by other layout items marked as label blockers for this map.

memberdef.argsstring: (QPainter *painter, const QgsRectangle &extent, QSizeF size, double dpi)
memberdef.name: drawMap

briefdescription.para: Draw to paint device.
Returns current layer style overrides for this map item.
Creates a transform from layout coordinates to map coordinates.
MapPolygon variant using a given extent.
Refresh the map's extents, considering data defined extent, scale and rotation.

parameterdescription.para: expression context for evaluating data defined map parameters

briefdescription.para: Test if a part of the item needs to be drawn, considering the context's current export layer.
Removes layer ids from mLayerSet that are no longer present in the qgis main map.
Returns extent that considers mOffsetX / mOffsetY (during content move)
Scales a layout map shift (in layout units) and rotates it by mRotation.

parameterdescription.para: in: shift in x direction (in item units), out: xShift in map units
in: shift in y direction (in item units), out: yShift in map units

briefdescription.para: Resets the item tooltip to reflect current map id.
Layout graphical items for displaying a map.
